reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived rather late and very tired from a long drive. The charming lady on the desk kindly gave us an upgrade to a beautiful room on the first floor (No 32) overlooking the cobbled street.
reviews.title: Quiet and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Public areas are delightful as is the breakfast. Location is brilliant; only minutes from the old harbour but far enough to be quiet. Sadly we had only booked for the one night but will certainly return on a future occasion to this small, friendly and comfortable hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel in Honfleur !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed in Hotel du Dauphin for 3 nights and loved it ! It is in the perfet location for exploring Normandy and Honfleur. The room had 2 twin beds that we pushed together and had a nice bathroom with shower. We learned to book rooms with twin beds in Eurpoe as the rooms tend to be bigger. The hotel is beautiful from the outside and is right across from the church. There was a market right outside of our window on Saturday morning, so fun !! The streets are cobblestone and the area is so beautiful. Free parking in a lot a short walk from town, great seaside bay for walks and so many beautiful photos. Bakery around the corner for our morning croissant , or the hotel has a lovely breakfast with tea/coffee, eggs, cereal, coffee cake, ffresh fruit salad, toast, cheese, for 9 euros. Best breakfast we saw in the hotels we stayed in. The staff was the best yet. They were eager to please and went above and beyond for us . They truly made our stay memorable. We were in France for 3 weeks and this was our favorite hotel. Thanks Hotel du dauphin !
reviews.title: Ideal base to explore Honfleur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel du Dauphin was a perfect base in beautiful Honfleur, close to the harbor and the church, with many shops and restaurants conveniently nearby. The hotel was clean and attractive, with very friendly and helpful staff. Driving in Honfleur is challenging, and the staff directed us to the public car park, where the car stayed while we explored everything on foot. We did not try the breakfast. It was a good value, as we got one room with a separate twin-bedded sleeping area for our teenagers. Having only one bathroom with teenagers is a bit tricky, and the twin beds were a bit small for teenagers, so I recommend this room for families with smaller children.
reviews.title: Charming, well located, but a bit cramped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We found Hotel du Dauphin to be a good choice for our stay in Honfleur. We had two adults in one room and two teenagers in another room. The hotel is small as are the staircases and rooms. That made porting luggage a bit of a pain, but isn't too unexpected.
reviews.title: no other choice in Honfleur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived after a long drive from the South and were made very welcome.The hotel is well situated near the centre of Honfleur, but with the disadvantage that parking is several hundred yards away Our room (15) was in the nearby annexe up a spiral flight of stairs which could be problematic for anyone unsteady on their feet, but the hotel staff kindly helped us with our suitcase. The room was clean and comfortable with a good shower. We stayed over a weekend and were intrigued by the Sunday antiques market set up in the square outside and neighbouring streets.Inj addition to the help mentioned above the staff also provided us with an earlier then normal breakfast on our final day as we wanted to be in Calais by 10.30. If you want to be in the centre of Honfleur this is certainly one to consider,but we recommend booking ahead as it was full in early October and people were coming in looking for somewhere reasonably priced to stay.
reviews.title: Comfortable and well situated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed here last week for 3 nights in a 'superior room' for 3 people. Lovely little room with a super bathroom [no.3] on the 1st floor, but no way is it big enough for 3 people or in any way superior. It was clean and the location on the 1st floor was ok if you are fit and have no problem climbing steep and narrow stairs. We had my elderly overweight mother-in-law and it was a struggle getting her to and from the room as well as all sleeping in there. Apart from that the location is great, the breakfast excellent and if you are smart you can get a car parking space outside from 7pm till 9am the following day, there is free parking about 7-8 minute walk up the street. We used Honfleur as a base to go to Bayeux and the D-Day beaches and came back in the evening to enjoy the wonderful atmosphere and very reasonable food and wine on offer in many of the restaurants. Please remember if you order beer they will rip you off, anywhere from £5-50 to £7-50 for a large beer with a lot of froth at the top. Well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this Hotel in Mid October. The location was wonderful, the staff was very helpful, and the room was clean, bed comfortable and the bathroom was large. We were not in the main building, so we did not have WIFI in our room. That would be my only complaint. We did feel that the breakfast they offered was a bit overpriced but convenient. We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: First Time in Hon Fleur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here recently with friends. The narrow and, in places, steep staircases could be a problem to the less able. Everywhere was clean and comfortable, and staff friendly and helpful.. The breakfast was very good with plenty of choice including a nice fresh fruit salad. Excellent location in the centre of the town, despite this it was relatively quiet. We were directed to free parking an 8 minute walk from the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent location,friendly helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With a stairway so narrow and steep it could better be called a carpeted ladder, this is not a hotel for the older or less- fit guest. To compound the problems, they use light timers that seem to anticipate when you'll need to actually see where you're going and then shut off at the worst possible time and, with little or no light coming in from outside this can be a real hazard.
reviews.title: Better have strong legs--

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a lovely place in Honfleur. Its a nice twon with lots to do and lots to see and the Dauphin is a rather basic but greatly located place in the middle of town with friendly staff and good sized rooms. I can recommend the place.
reviews.title: A nice quaint spot on a nice French square

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving into Honfleur to get to the hotel is an absolute NIGHTMARE! The roads are one car wide- and yet most of them are two way. Add to that, they are original cobblestone from 100BC- and you'll likely be driving a rental car--- Just save yourself the grief and figure out from Google maps how to stay on D513 and park about a mile from the hotel in a great, huge, public (free) parking lot where you can leave your car overnight. It is a great walk in along a tree shaded path- then you can stand watch the sheer terror on the faces of the people who follow their GPS's into the town center- The hotel itself is great! I didn't find most people working there to speak really good English but they were very patient with us for being English speakers- the breakfast offered delicious croissants, yogurt and the usual European favorites. We stayed in the hotel itself (not the annex) so we had great internet access in our room-
reviews.title: Great place! But listen to my advice on parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Honfleur is a lovely, small, quaint town not to be missed. Hotel du Dauphin is in a great location, right in the middle of town. However, if you get one of the family rooms, you have to climb up about 5-6 stories with your luggage, on very narrow and curvy stairs. The rooms have very small windows, so if you are Claustrophobic, this is not the place for you. The rooms on the street level might work for you.
reviews.title: Quaint but very elementary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time we've stayed here (the first deferral years ago). It is only a two star hotel but punches above is weight in our opinion. Yes, rooms are small, but are beat and clean. The staff are just great and couldn't be more helpful. The location simply couldn't be better. There is only public parking available, but that's the price one pays for being in a very old town. We would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: fine hotel in old town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed just one night at the start of our holiday. It was a easy 2 and a half hour drive from Calais, upon arrival the friendly receptionist showed us to our room in the annex which although small, was clean and comfortable and had a wonderful view of the square and the cathedral. We stayed on a Friday night and Saturday is market day so there was a bit of noise outside our window from the stallholders setting up which wasn't too much of a problem, and you have the benefit of wonderful fruit, veg and cheese on your doorstep. Parking is difficult around the hotel but we were directed to free parking around 500m away. The many bars and restaurants around the lovely old port are just a short walk away. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on their food, we took breakfast at the port, half the price and twice the view!! We have started our Holidays off in Honfleur several times now, and probably will again in the future and will certainly consider using Hotel du Dauphin.
reviews.title: Good location for a short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel du Dauphin for the last evening of our 2-week French holiday and found it to be a great way to form our final memories of a great visit. We found the staff to be most charming, attentive, and helpful. We stayed in the annex – a short walk from reception but a tremendous room easily accessed from the street and with a great view of St. Catherine’s Church. The room and hotel amenities were all as advertised and reasonably priced. The stairs in the hotel’s fascinating but ancient building were indeed a challenge for bringing in the luggage, but the room was well worth the effort. Their WIFI coverage does not extend to the annex, so we couldn’t use our iPad in the room, but were able to take advantage of the WIFI in the reception area. We also appreciated the free parking available about 500 m away – a bit of a hike, but quite OK since driving around the single-lane streets of the former medieval town can be quite a challenge, and all of the town’s wonderful sites, restaurants, and shopping are within walking distance. Though not a setting that would easily accommodate families with small children, we heartily recommend the Hotel du Dauphin to everybody else.
reviews.title: A wonderful accommodation in a charming city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Loved the staff at this place, they were always so helpful, and that makes a big difference. Also the location could not be more perfect for exploring Honfleur. The rooms are indeed small, in some cases you have to duck your head! But overall, I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Great location, wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent location in the center of the town. Room had a great view of the main square. The staff were so friendly and helpful. Free parking was pointed out to us by them and is only a short walk away. Ok so bedroom was a bit small and the mattress hard but the bathroom was modern and both rooms kept clean, The overall charm/location of the building more than made up for any short comings. Would definitely use this Hotel again.
reviews.title: Perfect place for short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just come back from a 5 night stay at the Hotel du Dauphin and I would highly recommend it. The staff are really friendly, very obliging and speak good English.
reviews.title: Relaxed and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The comments made about the Car Park - Yes it is a walk but 5 mins at most but you can leave the car there without worrying about it. We were in the annexe and yes the stairs are narrow and twisty but the building is Very, very old and this just adds to the charm.
reviews.title: Nice spot but rooms a bit dated
